valueFormat.notes: Current progress value. Must be between 0 and maxValue. Represents the completed portion of the task. For percentage-based progress, use 0-100 range with maxValue=100 (default).
valueFormat.example:
45 // 45% complete when maxValue=100
3 // 3 of 10 steps when maxValue=10

commonMistakes.why: Progress bar should not exceed 100% completion
commonMistakes.impact: Visual overflow or progress bar appearing full when task incomplete
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure value <= maxValue, clamp value programmatically

valueFormat.notes: Maximum value representing 100% completion. Default is 100 for percentage-based progress. Use custom values for step-based progress (e.g., maxValue=5 for 5-step process).
valueFormat.example:
100 // Percentage-based (0-100)
10 // 10 steps total
500 // 500 files to process

valueFormat.notes: Progress bar variant. 'default': shows definite progress with value. 'indeterminate': animated loading indicator when progress is unknown (ignores value prop).

possibleValues.description: Determinate progress bar showing exact percentage/value
Animated loading indicator for unknown duration tasks

commonMistakes.mistake: Using variant='default' when progress is unknown
commonMistakes.why: Showing 0% or stuck progress confuses users
commonMistakes.impact: Users think process is frozen or not working

valueFormat.notes: When true, displays progress as semi-circle/gauge instead of linear bar. Useful for dashboard widgets and compact displays. Works with semiCircleWidth prop.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show as gauge/semi-circle
false // Show as linear bar (default)

valueFormat.notes: Width in pixels for semi-circle progress (only applies when semiCircle=true). Default is 300px. Adjusts both width and height proportionally.
When true, shows success state with green color and success icon. Use when progress reaches 100% or task completes successfully. Overrides normal progress display.
Message displayed in success state (requires success=true). Shows alongside success icon to confirm completion.
Icon name shown in success state. Default is 'line-check-neutral'. Use Insider icon system names.
When true, shows error/invalid state with red color and error icon. Use when task fails or encounters error during progress.
Error message displayed in invalid state (requires invalid=true). Explains what went wrong.
valueFormat.example:
'Upload failed - file too large'
'Processing error at step 3'

valueFormat.notes: How to display the invalid state. 'button': shows retry button with icon (emits click event). 'text': shows text message only.
valueFormat.example:
'button' // Show retry button
'text' // Show error message only

valueFormat.notes: Icon name shown in invalid state. Default is 'line-redo' (retry icon). Use Insider icon system names.
When true, shows description text alongside progress bar. Use with description prop to provide context about the ongoing task.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show description
false // Hide description (default)

valueFormat.notes: Description text shown when descriptionStatus=true. Provides context about what's being processed. Can include dynamic content like current step or filename.
valueFormat.example:
'Uploading report.pdf...'
'Processing 45 of 100 records'
'Step 3 of 5: Analyzing data'

valueFormat.notes: Position of description text relative to progress bar. Default is 'left'.
valueFormat.example:
'left' // Description on left (default)
'top' // Description above progress bar
'bottom' // Description below progress bar

valueFormat.notes: Alternative way to show completion state. Similar to success but without requiring success message/icon. Use for simple completion indication.

click.description: Emitted when user clicks the progress component (typically the retry button in invalid state)
click.when: User clicks retry button when invalid=true and invalidType='button'. Use to retry failed operation.

basicProgress.title: Basic Progress Bar
basicProgress.code:
<template>
  <InProgress
    id="upload-progress"
    :value="uploadProgress"
    :maxValue="100"
    :descriptionStatus="true"
    :description="`Uploading... ${uploadProgress}%`"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
const uploadProgress = ref(0);

// Simulate upload progress
const simulateUpload = () => {
  const interval = setInterval(() => {
    uploadProgress.value += 10;
    if (uploadProgress.value >= 100) {
      clearInterval(interval);
    }
  }, 500);
};
</script>

progressWithStates.title: Progress with Success/Error States
progressWithStates.code:
<template>
  <InProgress
    id="file-process"
    :value="progress"
    :maxValue="100"
    :success="isSuccess"
    :successMessage="'All files processed successfully!'"
    :invalid="isError"
    :invalidMessage="errorMessage"
    :invalidType="'button'"
    @click="retryProcess"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
const progress = ref(0);
const isSuccess = ref(false);
const isError = ref(false);
const errorMessage = ref('');

const processFiles = async () => {
  try {
    isError.value = false;
    for (let i = 0; i <= 100; i += 20) {
      progress.value = i;
      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500));
      
      // Simulate random error
      if (Math.random() > 0.8) {
        throw new Error('Processing failed at ' + i + '%');
      }
    }
    isSuccess.value = true;
  } catch (error) {
    isError.value = true;
    errorMessage.value = error.message;
  }
};

const retryProcess = () => {
  progress.value = 0;
  isError.value = false;
  processFiles();
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Determinate Progress (Known Duration)
implementationPatterns.description: Use when you can calculate exact progress percentage
implementationPatterns.when: File uploads, batch processing with known item count, paginated data loading, step-by-step wizards
pros: Clear user expectation of completion time
cons: Can stall if progress calculation is wrong

implementationPatterns.name: Indeterminate Progress (Unknown Duration)
implementationPatterns.description: Use when you cannot predict completion time
implementationPatterns.when: API calls without progress info, database queries, authentication flows, any operation with unpredictable duration
pros: No need to track exact progress
cons: May cause anxiety for long operations

implementationPatterns.name: Progress with Retry Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Allow users to retry failed operations
implementationPatterns.code:
<InProgress
  id="process"
  :value="progress"
  :invalid="hasError"
  :invalidMessage="errorMessage"
  :invalidType="'button'"
  @click="retryOperation"
/>

const retryOperation = async () => {
  progress.value = 0;
  hasError.value = false;
  await startOperation();
};
implementationPatterns.when: Network-dependent operations, file uploads, data synchronization, any failable async task
pros: No need to restart entire flow

useCases.title: File Upload Progress Tracking
useCases.description: Show real-time progress for single or multiple file uploads
useCases.example: Document management system where users upload reports, images, or datasets. Show individual progress bars for each file with success/error states and retry capability.

useCases.title: Dashboard KPI Gauges
useCases.description: Display performance metrics as semi-circle progress gauges
useCases.example: Marketing dashboard showing campaign completion rate, goal achievement percentage, budget utilization. Use semi-circle gauges for compact, at-a-glance metrics.

useCases.title: Multi-Step Workflow Progress
useCases.description: Track progress through sequential process steps
useCases.example: Data import wizard: validate → parse → verify → import → finalize. Show current step progress with descriptions and handle step failures with retry.

useCases.title: Background Task Monitoring
useCases.description: Show progress of long-running background operations
useCases.example: Report generation, data export, batch email sending. Use indeterminate progress initially, switch to determinate when progress info becomes available.

bestPractices.title: Always Provide Descriptive Feedback
bestPractices.description: Use descriptionStatus with meaningful messages about what's happening
bestPractices.reasoning: Generic progress bars without context create anxiety. Users need to know what's being processed and why it's taking time.

bestPractices.title: Choose Correct Variant Based on Knowledge
bestPractices.description: Use 'default' only when you can track actual progress, otherwise use 'indeterminate'
bestPractices.reasoning: Showing 0% progress or stuck percentages is worse than showing indeterminate loading. Don't fake progress.

bestPractices.title: Implement Retry for Network Operations
bestPractices.description: Always provide retry option for operations that can fail
bestPractices.reasoning: Network failures are common. Forcing users to restart entire flows is poor UX. Retry button saves time and frustration.

bestPractices.title: Show Success State Briefly Before Hiding
bestPractices.description: Display success state for 1-2 seconds before removing progress indicator
bestPractices.reasoning: Instant removal of progress can feel abrupt. Brief success confirmation provides closure and confirms completion.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not clamping progress value to maxValue
commonMistakes.why: Progress calculations can exceed 100% due to rounding or errors
commonMistakes.impact: Progress bar overflows visually or shows incorrect completion state

commonMistakes.why: Cannot track actual progress for API calls, auth flows, etc.
commonMistakes.impact: Progress stuck at 0%, users think app is frozen
commonMistakes.fix: Use variant='indeterminate' when progress is unknown

commonMistakes.why: Operations fail (network errors, timeouts, validation failures)
commonMistakes.impact: Progress stuck indefinitely, no way to recover
commonMistakes.fix: Always implement invalid state with retry option

commonMistakes.why: Users need visual confirmation of successful completion
commonMistakes.impact: Unclear if operation succeeded, users may retry unnecessarily
commonMistakes.fix: Set success=true when complete, show for 1-2 seconds

performanceNotes.description: Don't update progress on every byte/item, it causes excessive re-renders
performanceNotes.recommendation: Update progress in meaningful increments (5-10%) or throttle updates to every 100-200ms
performanceNotes.impact: High: Rapid progress updates can freeze UI on slow devices

performanceNotes.description: Multiple animated progress bars impact performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Limit visible indeterminate progress bars to 2-3 max. Consider using skeleton loaders for long lists.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: CSS animations for multiple progress bars consume CPU

performanceNotes.description: Progress tracking intervals must be cleared when component unmounts
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use onBeforeUnmount to clear intervals/timeouts. Consider using composables with automatic cleanup.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: Memory leaks from uncleaned intervals

accessibilityNotes.description: Progress component should have proper ARIA attributes for screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure component has role='progressbar', aria-valuenow, aria-valuemin, aria-valuemax, and aria-label
Add aria-busy='true' for indeterminate variant so screen readers announce loading state

accessibilityNotes.description: State changes should be announced to screen reader users
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use aria-live regions to announce success/error messages. Set aria-live='polite' for non-critical updates.

accessibilityNotes.description: Retry button in error state needs descriptive label
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure retry button has clear aria-label explaining what will be retried
